node.title: CST_Storage_14
node.doctext:
CST review archive 14

This is a storage node for CST reviews. Contents are moved her from [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 11/27/04, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_15].

See also Quest Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1], [CST_Storage_2|2], [CST_Storage_3|3], [CST_Storage_4|4], [CST_Storage_5|5], [CST_Storage_6|6], [CST_Storage_7|7], [CST_Storage_8|8], [CST_Storage_9|9], [CST_Storage_10|10], [CST_Storage_11|11], [CST_Storage_12|12], [CST_Storage_13|13], [CST_Storage_14|14].

11/27/04 Batch processed by gom

Writeup Title: [September 1, 1939]
Author: [Mitzi]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.11.21 (25 s) JohnnyGoodyear says Mmmm. Good morning baas. CST?
Mitzi Darlin, I'm afraid. This writeup doesn't appear to be compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy]. You need a more original content to qualify under [fair use]. If you'd like to update it for compliance and repost, I'd be glad to advise and assist. In fact, I'd be happy just to hear from you at all!
Tc = 626, Tq = 460, %q= 73%

Writeup Title: [Robinson Jeffers]
Author: [JohnnyGoodyear]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: Yes
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.11.18 (2.9 min) JohnnyGoodyear says I am hoping to get a CST approval on Robinson Jeffers :)....
Dood, you're good to go. In fact you've got enough original text here to rescue [Shine, Perishing Republic] if you want to work it into the mix. Feel free to add the [CST Approved] tag if you wish. BTW smarty pants, the CST doesn't Fuss or Dun, we RULE!
Tc = 1077, Tq = 156, %q= 14%

Hi there, Based on your claim that permission to reprint the lyrics is implicitly granted because the song is a free MP3 distrib, you can add the [CST Approved] tag to this if you like.
StrawberryFrog is claiming that copyright permission is implicitly granted because the song is a free MP3 distrib. I'm inclined to buy it pending any complaints.

Oops! This one needs a little tweak. A few more words will fix it right up. About 30 will bring it up to snuff. Please let me know what you decide. If it’s not updated by next [November 13,2004|Saturday] I’ll assume you decided to not update it and remove it:)
2004.11.9@12:50 [swankivy] says Re [right to the ways and the rules of the world] : I took out some lyrics rather than beefing up the content . . . there's only so much one can say about a song to describe it to people who haven't heard it, I kinda just wanted to give people an idea of the flavors of the songs, and this one is nothing remarkable so I chose to go the other direction and subtract rather than add. Does that put it in the neighborhood of CST Approved?
Yes it does! Go ahead and add the the hardlink [CST Approved]

Writeup Title:[Statement of Faith of the UCC]
Author:[Infinite Burn]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 44% Traditional Statement of Faith; 45% Modernized Statement of Faith
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:

2004.11.3@18:28 [GrouchyOldMan] says This looks suspicious too: [Statement of Faith of the UCC]
Hello Infinite Burn, Some research reveals that the UCC Statement of faith was first published in the late 50’s which puts it under copyright. If you’re interested in contacting the Pilgrim Press for permission to keep it here they can be reached at; http://tinyurl.com/6j6k7. The homepage is here: http://tinyurl.com/6el5c. There is a useful permission form [All-purpose, handy-dandy Copyright Release/Permission Request Form |here]. If I don’t hear from you by next [November 13,2004|Saturday] I’ll assume you have decided to not get the permission and remove it.
2004.11.7@5:18 [Infinite Burn] says as for the ucc statement of faith, it is not under copywrite, nor is its doxological variation adopted in 1981, as they are public statements adopted by their respective synods. Pilgrim Press has published the statement of faith in both forms in many publications listing it as without copywrite, they have exhaustive copywrite aknowledgements.
Okay dokey smoky! Please append the hardlink [CST Approved]
